question: Which of the following represents the five rings of the symbol of the Olympic Games?
option1: Five founders who played active role for the introduction of Olympic Games.
option3: Five major events which paved the way for the introduction of Olympic Games.
option4: Five major body parts vital for sports.
explanation: The five rings of the symbol of the Olympic Games represents fiveÂ continents of the world. The rings are five interlocking rings, coloured blue, yellow, black, green and red on a white field, known as the "Olympic rings". The symbol was originally created in 1913 by Pierre de Coubertin. He appears to have intended the rings to represent the five continents: Europe, Asia, Africa, The Americas, and Oceania. According to Coubertin, the colours of the rings together with the white of the background included the colours composing every competing nation's flag at the time.
